abstract: Federal agents and prosecutors charge 13 Detroit school principals with taking nearly $1 million in kickbacks from vendor to city's school system; officials believe more than half of $5 million in orders for school supplies, from paper to chairs, were fraudulent.
lead_paragraph: A federal prosecutor said $2.7 million of about $5 million in supply orders over several years was fraudulent.

headline.main: 13 Detroit School Principals Charged in Vendor Kickback Scheme
headline.print_headline: 13 Detroit Principals Charged With Taking Nearly $1 Million in Vendor Graft

snippet: A federal prosecutor said $2.7 million of about $5 million in supply orders over several years was fraudulent.
